articles.headline: Starbucks Takes a 3-Hour Coffee Break
articles.snippet: Starbucks temporarily closed stores as it retrained workers and tried to revive “the romance of coffee.”
articles.abstract: Starbucks temporarily closed stores as it retrained workers and tried to revive “the romance of coffee.”
articles.lead_paragraph: At Starbucks stores across the country on Tuesday night, it was time for the corporate version of re-education camp.

articles.headline: Surgeon Accused of Speeding a Death to Get Organs
articles.snippet: A doctor faces three felony counts in a case that has sent a shudder through the field of transplant surgeons.
articles.abstract: A doctor faces three felony counts in a case that has sent a shudder through the field of transplant surgeons.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN LUIS OBISPO, Calif.  On a winter night in 2006, a disabled and brain damaged man named Ruben Navarro was wheeled into an operating room at a hospital here. By most accounts, Mr. Navarro, 25, was near death, and doctors hoped that he might sustain other lives by donating his kidneys and liver.

articles.headline: Democrats Clash on Trade, Health and Tactics
articles.snippet: Barack Obama and Hillary Rodham Clinton set aside their cordiality and traded accusations in a contentious debate.
articles.abstract: Barack Obama and Hillary Rodham Clinton set aside their cordiality and traded accusations in a contentious debate.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton confronted Senator Barack Obama on health care, Nafta, Iraq and his political tactics on Tuesday night in one of her most pugnacious debate performances of the campaign, as she fought for fresh momentum before four potentially decisive nominating contests next Tuesday.
articles.byline: By Patrick Healy and Jeff Zeleny

articles.headline: A Highflier Loses Altitude as Google’s Clicks Go Flat
articles.snippet: Investors were spooked by a report by the research firm comScore that said clicks on Google ads in the United States were flat in January.
articles.abstract: Investors were spooked by a report by the research firm comScore that said clicks on Google ads in the United States were flat in January.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Are Internet users clicking on fewer Google ads and putting the company’s growth prospects at risk?

articles.headline: Gas Prices Soar, Posing a Threat to Family Budget
articles.snippet: Consumers’ pocketbooks are being hit hard as the oil shock coincides with turmoil in the credit and housing markets.
articles.abstract: Consumers’ pocketbooks are being hit hard as the oil shock coincides with turmoil in the credit and housing markets.
articles.lead_paragraph: Gasoline prices, which for months lagged behind the big run-up in the price of oil, are suddenly rising quickly, with some experts saying they could approach $4 a gallon by spring. Diesel is hitting new records daily, and oil settled at a record high of $100.88 a barrel on Tuesday.

articles.headline: Pilots’ Battles Over Seniority Play Havoc With Airline Mergers
articles.snippet: The battle over seniority between US Airways and America West has turned into one of the country’s nastiest union brawls.
articles.abstract: The battle over seniority between US Airways and America West has turned into one of the country’s nastiest union brawls.
articles.lead_paragraph: Merger talks between Delta Air Lines and Northwest Airlines have been held up for a couple of weeks while pilots at each carrier discuss how to combine their union seniority lists.

articles.headline: 20th Debate: Reality Show or a Spinoff?
articles.snippet: To make her point that the press was tougher on her than on Barack Obama, Hillary Rodham Clinton cited a “Saturday Night Live” sketch.
articles.abstract: To make her point that the press was tougher on her than on Barack Obama, Hillary Rodham Clinton cited a “Saturday Night Live” sketch.
articles.lead_paragraph: Everybody wanted to know which Hillary Rodham Clinton would show up to the Cleveland debate on Tuesday night. It turned out to be the Amy Poehler version.

articles.headline: The Politics of Trade in Ohio
articles.snippet: The Democratic presidential candidates’ tough attacks on Nafta mask a more nuanced approach to trade policy.
articles.abstract: The Democratic presidential candidates’ tough attacks on Nafta mask a more nuanced approach to trade policy.
articles.lead_paragraph: Watching Barack Obama and Hillary Clinton compete with each other to say the nastiest possible thing about the Nafta trade deal has made me think about the politics of abortion.

articles.headline: New Worries on Inflation and Homes
articles.snippet: The confluence of falling home prices and accelerating inflation is putting policy makers in an increasingly tough position.
articles.abstract: The confluence of falling home prices and accelerating inflation is putting policy makers in an increasingly tough position.
articles.lead_paragraph: Houses are getting cheaper by the month. Everything else is becoming more expensive.
